comments.content: Agree! Even there are some NICs are hot-swappable but since the question is asking "normally" so the answer should be A&D as long as there is a redundant power supplyXD

discussion.content: Correct answer should be D. Power supply

questions.question_text: A junior systems administrator wants to know which components on a server are normally hot-swappable. Which of the following components are usually hot- swappable? (Select TWO).

choices.A: The servers will continue to operate normally due to their redundant power sources.
choices.C: All of the servers will lose power immediately because both circuit breakers will switch off.
choices.B: The servers will shut down gracefully when power is lost on one of the two circuits.
choices.D: Half of the servers will lose power, but the others will continue operating on the good circuit.

questions.question_text:
A rack contains 20 1U servers with dual power supplies and two PDUs on separate 15A circuits. Each server is connected to both PDUs, and each server draws
1A of current in normal operation. One of the circuit breakers switches off due to a power surge. Which of the following will happen NEXT?

discussion.content:
I believe the answer should be "B. use the maximum amount of memory".
Why?:
"Disk Thrashing is a problem that may occur when virtual memory is being used. As main memory fills up, then more and more pages need to be swapped in and out of virtual memory. This swapping leads to a very high rate of hard disk access. Compared to RAM, moving a hard disk head takes thousands of times longer."

questions.question_text: A server administrator wants to minimize the amount of disk thrashing on a server. The BEST way to accomplish this would be to:

choices.D: use a cached disk controller with battery backup.
choices.B: use the maximum amount of memory.
choices.A: use hard disks with high throughput.

questions.question_text: A technician is troubleshooting a blade server with correctable memory errors on only one DIMM. Which of the following troubleshooting steps should the technician take FIRST?

discussion.content: If it were me, I’d swap the dimm to ensure the error follows the dimm. I’ve seen slots go bad too.

comments.content:
Agree. In reality, we often do that to make sure if we do need to perform the replacement...
But I think A is still the most suitable answer by the exam cuz theoretically the possibility of broken DIMM is still higher than slot.

choices.A: Replace the suspected failed DIMM with a new DIMM
choices.D: Apply all OS and applications software patches
choices.B: Swap locations of the DIMM with a known-good DIMM
choices.C: Replace all the DIMMs in the suspect bank of memory

discussion.content: Correct answer should be A. when channeling cables in a rack for a 2U server

questions.question_text: A cable management arm should be used:

choices.D: when channeling cables in a rack for a 48-port switch
choices.B: when channeling cables in a rack for a UPS
choices.A: when channeling cables in a rack for a 2U server
choices.C: when channeling cables on a tower server
